meanings.definition: The part of a building or ship above the main deck.
meanings.sent1: The superstructure of the ship included the cabins for the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The workers were busy constructing the superstructure of the new office building.
meanings.sent3: The superstructure of the house looked like a giant hat sitting on top.
meanings.sent4: The superstructure of the skyscraper reached towards the sky like a colossal tower.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the superstructure made it stand out among the other buildings.

meanings.definition: A structure built on top of something else.
meanings.sent1: The playground's superstructure provided a fun area for the children to play.
meanings.sent2: The superstructure of the bridge was carefully engineered to support heavy traffic.
meanings.sent3: The superstructure of the cake was a mini replica of a famous landmark.
meanings.sent4: The superstructure of the treehouse resembled a cozy cabin in the woods.
meanings.sent5: The superstructure of the monument symbolized strength and unity.

meanings.definition: The part of a building above the foundation.
meanings.sent1: The superstructure of the house included the upper floors and roof.
meanings.sent2: The architect focused on designing a unique superstructure for the museum.
meanings.sent3: The superstructure of the sandcastle looked like a miniature palace.
meanings.sent4: The superstructure of the fortress protected the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the superstructure left visitors in awe of the building's beauty.
